name: Sandra's TFG Questionnaire
description: The questions of the daily questionnaire have been carefully selected from different standardized questionnaires: PSQI, IPAQ-SF, UCLA, PANAS and NASA-TLX, adapting some answers to refer to the current day rather than covering a longer period.

questions.text: How would you rate the quality of last night's sleep?
How long (in minutes) did it take you to fall asleep last night?
How many times throughout the day have you had difficulties staying awake? (e.g., during class, work, meals, social activities, or driving)
Did you engage in any form of exercise today? (excluding walking; e.g., running, cycling, any sports)
answers: I wanted to exercise, but I didn't have time

questions.text: How much time have you spent sitting today? (Include time spent at work, at home, while doing chores, and during leisure time; e.g., sitting at a desk/table, at a bar with friends, reading, watching television...)

Rate on a scale of 1-5 how you have felt throughout the day:
I have felt in harmony with the people around me:

Rate on a scale of 1-5 how you have felt throughout the day:
I have felt lonely:

Rate on a scale of 1-5 how you are feeling right now:
Stressed:

Rate on a scale of 1 (very low) to 5 (very high) the demands of your workload today:
MENTAL DEMAND:
How much mental and perceptual activity was required? (e.g., thinking, deciding, calculating, remembering, searching, investigating, etc.) Was it an easy or difficult task, simple or complex, heavy or light?

Rate on a scale of 1 (very low) to 5 (very high) the demands of your workload today:
PHYSICAL DEMAND:
How much physical activity was required? (e.g., pushing, pulling, turning, pressing, operating, etc.) Was it an easy or difficult task, slow or fast, relaxed or strenuous?

Rate on a scale of 1 (very low) to 5 (very high) the demands of your workload today:
TIME DEMAND:
How much time pressure did you feel due to the pace at which tasks or task elements were occurring? Was the pace slow and leisurely or fast and frantic?

Rate on a scale of 1 (very low) to 5 (very high) the demands of your workload today:
EFFORT:
To what extent did you have to work to achieve your level of results?

Rate on a scale of 1 (very low) to 5 (very high) the demands of your workload today:
PERFORMANCE:
To what extent do you believe you have been successful in the objectives set by your boss, supervisor, or yourself? How satisfied are you with your level of performance?

Rate on a scale of 1 (very low) to 5 (very high) the demands of your workload today:
FRUSTRATION LEVEL:
During the task, to what extent have you felt secure, content, relaxed, and satisfied?
